body_html:
For context this should only an issue if real-time tracking is not enabled (i.e. if libtensorflow_demo.so is not found). When tracking is active the normalized cross-correlation check of the object's initial vs current appearance will catch the track loss and remove the box automatically.

This is probably not the optimal behavior, so a PR to tweak it would be appreciated (though we do not want to destroy the persistence in the tracking-enabled scenario as this edit would).

For context this should only an issue if real-time tracking is not enabled (i.e. if libtensorflow_demo.so is not found). When tracking is active the normalized cross-correlation check of the object's initial vs current appearance will catch the track loss and remove the box automatically.

This is probably not the optimal behavior, so a PR to tweak it would be appreciated (though we do not want to destroy the persistence in the tracking-enabled scenario as this edit would).
